Often used in the context of category or subject classification, glossaries or dictionaries, product or creative work types, etc. Use the name property for the term being defined, use termCode if the term has an alpha-numeric code allocated, use description to provide the definition of the term.

schema:globalLocationNumber.description: The [Global Location Number](http://www.gs1.org/gln) (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

schema:weight.title: weight

anyOf.title: QuantitativeValue
anyOf.description: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

schema:knowsLanguage.title: knowsLanguage
schema:knowsLanguage.description: Of a [[Person]], and less typically of an [[Organization]], to indicate a known language. We do not distinguish skill levels or reading/writing/speaking/signing here. Use language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47).

anyOf.title: Language
anyOf.description: Natural languages such as Spanish, Tamil, Hindi, English, etc. Formal language code tags expressed in [BCP 47](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) can be used via the [[alternateName]] property. The Language type previously also covered programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, which are now best represented using [[ComputerLanguage]].

schema:netWorth.title: netWorth
schema:netWorth.description: The total financial value of the person as calculated by subtracting assets from liabilities.

anyOf.title: MonetaryAmount
anyOf.description: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use [[PriceSpecification]] Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

anyOf.title: PriceSpecification
anyOf.description: A structured value representing a price or price range. Typically, only the subclasses of this type are used for markup. It is recommended to use [[MonetaryAmount]] to describe independent amounts of money such as a salary, credit card limits, etc.

schema:award.title: award
schema:award.description: An award won by or for this item.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

schema:honorificSuffix.title: honorificSuffix

schema:publishingPrinciples.title: publishingPrinciples
schema:publishingPrinciples.description:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via [[URL]]) a document describing the editorial principles of an [[Organization]] (or individual e.g. a [[Person]] writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a [[CreativeWork]] (e.g. [[NewsArticle]]) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the [[CreativeWork]].

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a [[funder]]) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

anyOf.title: CreativeWork
anyOf.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

anyOf.title: URL

schema:gender.title: gender
schema:gender.description: Gender of something, typically a [[Person]], but possibly also fictional characters, animals, etc. While https://schema.org/Male and https://schema.org/Female may be used, text strings are also acceptable for people who do not identify as a binary gender. The [[gender]] property can also be used in an extended sense to cover e.g. the gender of sports teams. As with the gender of individuals, we do not try to enumerate all possibilities. A mixed-gender [[SportsTeam]] can be indicated with a text value of "Mixed".

anyOf.title: Offer
anyOf.description:
An offer to transfer some rights to an item or to provide a service — for example, an offer to sell tickets to an event, to rent the DVD of a movie, to stream a TV show over the internet, to repair a motorcycle, or to loan a book.

Note: As the [[businessFunction]] property, which identifies the form of offer (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose), defaults to http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell; an Offer without a defined businessFunction value can be assumed to be an offer to sell.

For [GTIN](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin)-related fields, see [Check Digit calculator](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/support/check_digit_calculator) and [validation guide](http://www.gs1us.org/resources/standards/gtin-validation-guide) from [GS1](http://www.gs1.org/).

schema:availableLanguage.title: availableLanguage
schema:availableLanguage.description: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]]

anyOf.title: Language
anyOf.description: Natural languages such as Spanish, Tamil, Hindi, English, etc. Formal language code tags expressed in [BCP 47](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) can be used via the [[alternateName]] property. The Language type previously also covered programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, which are now best represented using [[ComputerLanguage]].

schema:serviceArea.title: serviceArea
schema:serviceArea.description: The geographic area where the service is provided.

schema:hoursAvailable.title: hoursAvailable
schema:hoursAvailable.description: The hours during which this service or contact is available.

anyOf.title: OpeningHoursSpecification
anyOf.description:
A structured value providing information about the opening hours of a place or a certain service inside a place.


The place is __open__ if the [[opens]] property is specified, and __closed__ otherwise.

If the value for the [[closes]] property is less than the value for the [[opens]] property then the hour range is assumed to span over the next day.

schema:contactOption.title: contactOption
schema:contactOption.description: An option available on this contact point (e.g. a toll-free number or support for hearing-impaired callers).

anyOf.title: ContactPointOption
anyOf.description: Enumerated options related to a ContactPoint.

schema:productSupported.title: productSupported
schema:productSupported.description: The product or service this support contact point is related to (such as product support for a particular product line). This can be a specific product or product line (e.g. "iPhone") or a general category of products or services (e.g. "smartphones").

anyOf.title: Product
anyOf.description: Any offered product or service. For example: a pair of shoes; a concert ticket; the rental of a car; a haircut; or an episode of a TV show streamed online.

schema:geo.title: geo
schema:geo.description: The geo coordinates of the place.

anyOf.title: GeoShape
anyOf.description: The geographic shape of a place. A GeoShape can be described using several properties whose values are based on latitude/longitude pairs. Either whitespace or commas can be used to separate latitude and longitude; whitespace should be used when writing a list of several such points.

anyOf.title: GeoCoordinates
anyOf.description: The geographic coordinates of a place or event.

schema:geoEquals.title: geoEquals
schema:geoEquals.description: Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) are topologically equal, as defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM). "Two geometries are topologically equal if their interiors intersect and no part of the interior or boundary of one geometry intersects the exterior of the other" (a symmetric relationship)

anyOf.title: GeospatialGeometry
anyOf.description: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

schema:publicAccess.title: publicAccess
schema:publicAccess.description: A flag to signal that the [[Place]] is open to public visitors.  If this property is omitted there is no assumed default boolean value

schema:geoDisjoint.title: geoDisjoint
schema:geoDisjoint.description: Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) are topologically disjoint: they have no point in common. They form a set of disconnected geometries." (a symmetric relationship, as defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM))

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

anyOf.title: GeospatialGeometry
anyOf.description: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

schema:geoTouches.title: geoTouches
schema:geoTouches.description: Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) touch: they have at least one boundary point in common, but no interior points." (a symmetric relationship, as defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM) )

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

anyOf.title: GeospatialGeometry
anyOf.description: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

schema:specialOpeningHoursSpecification.title: specialOpeningHoursSpecification
schema:specialOpeningHoursSpecification.description: The special opening hours of a certain place.\n\nUse this to explicitly override general opening hours brought in scope by [[openingHoursSpecification]] or [[openingHours]].

anyOf.title: OpeningHoursSpecification
anyOf.description:
A structured value providing information about the opening hours of a place or a certain service inside a place.


The place is __open__ if the [[opens]] property is specified, and __closed__ otherwise.

If the value for the [[closes]] property is less than the value for the [[opens]] property then the hour range is assumed to span over the next day.

schema:globalLocationNumber.title: globalLocationNumber
schema:globalLocationNumber.description: The [Global Location Number](http://www.gs1.org/gln) (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

schema:hasDriveThroughService.title: hasDriveThroughService
schema:hasDriveThroughService.description: Indicates whether some facility (e.g. [[FoodEstablishment]], [[CovidTestingFacility]]) offers a service that can be used by driving through in a car. In the case of [[CovidTestingFacility]] such facilities could potentially help with social distancing from other potentially-infected users.

schema:maximumAttendeeCapacity.title: maximumAttendeeCapacity
schema:maximumAttendeeCapacity.description: The total number of individuals that may attend an event or venue.

anyOf.description: Specifies a location feature by providing a structured value representing a feature of an accommodation as a property-value pair of varying degrees of formality.

anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

schema:slogan.title: slogan
schema:slogan.description: A slogan or motto associated with the item.

schema:containedInPlace.title: containedInPlace
schema:containedInPlace.description: The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it.

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

The code is typically assigned by the parentOrganization and used in structured URLs.\n\nFor example, in the URL http://www.starbucks.co.uk/store-locator/etc/detail/3047 the code "3047" is a branchCode for a particular branch.

schema:geoContains.description: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a containing geometry to a contained geometry. "a contains b iff no points of b lie in the exterior of a, and at least one point of the interior of b lies in the interior of a". As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

schema:latitude.description: The latitude of a location. For example ```37.42242``` ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:events.title: events
schema:events.description: Upcoming or past events associated with this place or organization.

anyOf.title: Event
anyOf.description: An event happening at a certain time and location, such as a concert, lecture, or festival. Ticketing information may be added via the [[offers]] property. Repeated events may be structured as separate Event objects.

schema:geoOverlaps.title: geoOverlaps
schema:geoOverlaps.description: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to another that geospatially overlaps it, i.e. they have some but not all points in common. As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

anyOf.title: GeospatialGeometry
anyOf.description: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

anyOf.title: Review
anyOf.description: A review of an item - for example, of a restaurant, movie, or store.

schema:openingHoursSpecification.title: openingHoursSpecification
schema:openingHoursSpecification.description: The opening hours of a certain place.

anyOf.title: OpeningHoursSpecification
anyOf.description:
A structured value providing information about the opening hours of a place or a certain service inside a place.


The place is __open__ if the [[opens]] property is specified, and __closed__ otherwise.

If the value for the [[closes]] property is less than the value for the [[opens]] property then the hour range is assumed to span over the next day.

anyOf.title: Review
anyOf.description: A review of an item - for example, of a restaurant, movie, or store.

schema:map.title: map
schema:map.description: A URL to a map of the place.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:additionalProperty.title: additionalProperty
schema:additionalProperty.description: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. https://schema.org/width, https://schema.org/color, https://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

anyOf.title: PropertyValue
anyOf.description: A property-value pair, e.g. representing a feature of a product or place. Use the 'name' property for the name of the property. If there is an additional human-readable version of the value, put that into the 'description' property.\n\n Always use specific schema.org properties when a) they exist and b) you can populate them. Using PropertyValue as a substitute will typically not trigger the same effect as using the original, specific property.

schema:isAccessibleForFree.title: isAccessibleForFree
schema:isAccessibleForFree.description: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

schema:event.title: event
schema:event.description: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

anyOf.title: Event
anyOf.description: An event happening at a certain time and location, such as a concert, lecture, or festival. Ticketing information may be added via the [[offers]] property. Repeated events may be structured as separate Event objects.

schema:hasMap.title: hasMap
schema:hasMap.description: A URL to a map of the place.

anyOf.title: Map
anyOf.description: A map.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:polygon.title: polygon
schema:polygon.description: A polygon is the area enclosed by a point-to-point path for which the starting and ending points are the same. A polygon is expressed as a series of four or more space delimited points where the first and final points are identical.

schema:line.title: line
schema:line.description: A line is a point-to-point path consisting of two or more points. A line is expressed as a series of two or more point objects separated by space.

schema:circle.title: circle
schema:circle.description: A circle is the circular region of a specified radius centered at a specified latitude and longitude. A circle is expressed as a pair followed by a radius in meters.

schema:elevation.title: elevation
schema:elevation.description: The elevation of a location ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)). Values may be of the form 'NUMBER UNIT_OF_MEASUREMENT' (e.g., '1,000 m', '3,200 ft') while numbers alone should be assumed to be a value in meters.

anyOf.title: PostalAddress
anyOf.description: The mailing address.

schema:box.title: box
schema:box.description: A box is the area enclosed by the rectangle formed by two points. The first point is the lower corner, the second point is the upper corner. A box is expressed as two points separated by a space character.

schema:addressCountry.title: addressCountry
schema:addressCountry.description: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1).

anyOf.title: Country
anyOf.description: A country.

schema:streetAddress.title: streetAddress
schema:streetAddress.description: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.

schema:addressLocality.title: addressLocality
schema:addressLocality.description: The locality in which the street address is, and which is in the region. For example, Mountain View.

schema:postOfficeBoxNumber.title: postOfficeBoxNumber
schema:postOfficeBoxNumber.description: The post office box number for PO box addresses.

schema:addressCountry.title: addressCountry
schema:addressCountry.description: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1).

anyOf.title: Country
anyOf.description: A country.

schema:addressRegion.title: addressRegion
schema:addressRegion.description: The region in which the locality is, and which is in the country. For example, California or another appropriate first-level [Administrative division](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_administrative_divisions_by_country)

schema:longitude.title: longitude
schema:longitude.description: The longitude of a location. For example ```-122.08585``` ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

schema:latitude.title: latitude
schema:latitude.description: The latitude of a location. For example ```37.42242``` ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

schema:elevation.title: elevation
schema:elevation.description: The elevation of a location ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)). Values may be of the form 'NUMBER UNIT_OF_MEASUREMENT' (e.g., '1,000 m', '3,200 ft') while numbers alone should be assumed to be a value in meters.

anyOf.title: PostalAddress
anyOf.description: The mailing address.

schema:addressCountry.title: addressCountry
schema:addressCountry.description: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1).

anyOf.title: Country
anyOf.description: A country.

schema:mainEntityOfPage.title: mainEntityOfPage
schema:mainEntityOfPage.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#mainEntityBackground) for details.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

anyOf.title: CreativeWork
anyOf.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

schema:additionalType.title: additionalType
schema:additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:sameAs.title: sameAs
schema:sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:identifier.title: identifier
schema:identifier.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of [[Thing]], such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#identifierBg) for more details.

anyOf.title: PropertyValue
anyOf.description: A property-value pair, e.g. representing a feature of a product or place. Use the 'name' property for the name of the property. If there is an additional human-readable version of the value, put that into the 'description' property.\n\n Always use specific schema.org properties when a) they exist and b) you can populate them. Using PropertyValue as a substitute will typically not trigger the same effect as using the original, specific property.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:potentialAction.title: potentialAction
schema:potentialAction.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

anyOf.title: Action
anyOf.description: An action performed by a direct agent and indirect participants upon a direct object. Optionally happens at a location with the help of an inanimate instrument. The execution of the action may produce a result. Specific action sub-type documentation specifies the exact expectation of each argument/role.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/04/announcing-schemaorg-actions.html) and [Actions overview document](https://schema.org/docs/actions.html).

schema:subjectOf.title: subjectOf
schema:subjectOf.description: A CreativeWork or Event about this Thing.

anyOf.title: CreativeWork
anyOf.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

anyOf.title: Event
anyOf.description: An event happening at a certain time and location, such as a concert, lecture, or festival. Ticketing information may be added via the [[offers]] property. Repeated events may be structured as separate Event objects.

schema:disambiguatingDescription.title: disambiguatingDescription
schema:disambiguatingDescription.description: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.

schema:image.title: image
schema:image.description: An image of the item. This can be a [[URL]] or a fully described [[ImageObject]].

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

anyOf.title: ImageObject
anyOf.description: An image file.

schema:pattern.title: pattern
schema:pattern.description: A pattern that something has, for example 'polka dot', 'striped', 'Canadian flag'. Values are typically expressed as text, although links to controlled value schemes are also supported.

anyOf.title: DefinedTerm
anyOf.description: A word, name, acronym, phrase, etc. with a formal definition. Often used in the context of category or subject classification, glossaries or dictionaries, product or creative work types, etc. Use the name property for the term being defined, use termCode if the term has an alpha-numeric code allocated, use description to provide the definition of the term.

schema:creditText.title: creditText
schema:creditText.description: Text that can be used to credit person(s) and/or organization(s) associated with a published Creative Work.

schema:about.title: about
schema:about.description: The subject matter of the content.

anyOf.title: Thing
anyOf.description: The most generic type of item.

schema:text.title: text
schema:text.description: The textual content of this CreativeWork.

schema:character.title: character
schema:character.description: Fictional person connected with a creative work.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

schema:offers.title: offers
schema:offers.description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event. Use [[businessFunction]] to indicate the kind of transaction offered, i.e. sell, lease, etc. This property can also be used to describe a [[Demand]]. While this property is listed as expected on a number of common types, it can be used in others. In that case, using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer.

anyOf.title: Demand
anyOf.description: A demand entity represents the public, not necessarily binding, not necessarily exclusive, announcement by an organization or person to seek a certain type of goods or services. For describing demand using this type, the very same properties used for Offer apply.

anyOf.title: Offer
anyOf.description:
An offer to transfer some rights to an item or to provide a service — for example, an offer to sell tickets to an event, to rent the DVD of a movie, to stream a TV show over the internet, to repair a motorcycle, or to loan a book.

Note: As the [[businessFunction]] property, which identifies the form of offer (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose), defaults to http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell; an Offer without a defined businessFunction value can be assumed to be an offer to sell.

For [GTIN](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin)-related fields, see [Check Digit calculator](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/support/check_digit_calculator) and [validation guide](http://www.gs1us.org/resources/standards/gtin-validation-guide) from [GS1](http://www.gs1.org/).

schema:locationCreated.title: locationCreated
schema:locationCreated.description: The location where the CreativeWork was created, which may not be the same as the location depicted in the CreativeWork.

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

schema:isBasedOnUrl.title: isBasedOnUrl
schema:isBasedOnUrl.description: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

anyOf.title: CreativeWork
anyOf.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

anyOf.title: Product
anyOf.description: Any offered product or service. For example: a pair of shoes; a concert ticket; the rental of a car; a haircut; or an episode of a TV show streamed online.

schema:isPartOf.title: isPartOf
schema:isPartOf.description: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense), is part of.

anyOf.title: CreativeWork
anyOf.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

description.@value: The quantity of the materials being described or an expression of the physical space they occupy.

anyOf.title: QuantitativeValue
anyOf.description: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

schema:contentReferenceTime.title: contentReferenceTime
schema:contentReferenceTime.description: The specific time described by a creative work, for works (e.g. articles, video objects etc.) that emphasise a particular moment within an Event.

schema:maintainer.title: maintainer
schema:maintainer.description: A maintainer of a [[Dataset]], software package ([[SoftwareApplication]]), or other [[Project]]. A maintainer is a [[Person]] or [[Organization]] that manages contributions to, and/or publication of, some (typically complex) artifact. It is common for distributions of software and data to be based on "upstream" sources. When [[maintainer]] is applied to a specific version of something e.g. a particular version or packaging of a [[Dataset]], it is always  possible that the upstream source has a different maintainer. The [[isBasedOn]] property can be used to indicate such relationships between datasets to make the different maintenance roles clear. Similarly in the case of software, a package may have dedicated maintainers working on integration into software distributions such as Ubuntu, as well as upstream maintainers of the underlying work.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

schema:typicalAgeRange.title: typicalAgeRange
schema:typicalAgeRange.description: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

schema:author.title: author
schema:author.description: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

schema:funder.title: funder
schema:funder.description: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

schema:expires.title: expires
schema:expires.description: Date the content expires and is no longer useful or available. For example a [[VideoObject]] or [[NewsArticle]] whose availability or relevance is time-limited, or a [[ClaimReview]] fact check whose publisher wants to indicate that it may no longer be relevant (or helpful to highlight) after some date.

schema:genre.title: genre
schema:genre.description: Genre of the creative work, broadcast channel or group.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:workTranslation.title: workTranslation
schema:workTranslation.description: A work that is a translation of the content of this work. e.g. 西遊記 has an English workTranslation “Journey to the West”,a German workTranslation “Monkeys Pilgerfahrt” and a Vietnamese  translation Tây du ký bình khảo.

anyOf.title: CreativeWork
anyOf.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

schema:aggregateRating.title: aggregateRating
schema:aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

anyOf.title: AggregateRating
anyOf.description: The average rating based on multiple ratings or reviews.

schema:award.title: award
schema:award.description: An award won by or for this item.

schema:temporalCoverage.title: temporalCoverage
schema:temporalCoverage.description:
The temporalCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the period that the content applies to, i.e. that it describes, either as a DateTime or as a textual string indicating a time period in [ISO 8601 time interval format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Time_intervals). In
      the case of a Dataset it will typically indicate the relevant time period in a precise notation (e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 would be written "2011/2012"). Other forms of content e.g. ScholarlyArticle, Book, TVSeries or TVEpisode may indicate their temporalCoverage in broader terms - textually or via well-known URL.
      Written works such as books may sometimes have precise temporal coverage too, e.g. a work set in 1939 - 1945 can be indicated in ISO 8601 interval format format via "1939/1945".

Open-ended date ranges can be written with ".." in place of the end date. For example, "2015-11/.." indicates a range beginning in November 2015 and with no specified final date. This is tentative and might be updated in future when ISO 8601 is officially updated.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:hasPart.title: hasPart
schema:hasPart.description: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that is part of this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense).

anyOf.title: CreativeWork
anyOf.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

schema:accessibilitySummary.title: accessibilitySummary
schema:accessibilitySummary.description: A human-readable summary of specific accessibility features or deficiencies, consistent with the other accessibility metadata but expressing subtleties such as "short descriptions are present but long descriptions will be needed for non-visual users" or "short descriptions are present and no long descriptions are needed."

schema:accessModeSufficient.title: accessModeSufficient
schema:accessModeSufficient.description: A list of single or combined accessModes that are sufficient to understand all the intellectual content of a resource. Expected values include:  auditory, tactile, textual, visual.

anyOf.title: ItemList
anyOf.description: A list of items of any sort—for example, Top 10 Movies About Weathermen, or Top 100 Party Songs. Not to be confused with HTML lists, which are often used only for formatting.

schema:educationalAlignment.title: educationalAlignment
schema:educationalAlignment.description:
An alignment to an established educational framework.

This property should not be used where the nature of the alignment can be described using a simple property, for example to express that a resource [[teaches]] or [[assesses]] a competency.

anyOf.title: AlignmentObject
anyOf.description:
An intangible item that describes an alignment between a learning resource and a node in an educational framework.

Should not be used where the nature of the alignment can be described using a simple property, for example to express that a resource [[teaches]] or [[assesses]] a competency.

schema:publishingPrinciples.title: publishingPrinciples
schema:publishingPrinciples.description:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via [[URL]]) a document describing the editorial principles of an [[Organization]] (or individual e.g. a [[Person]] writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a [[CreativeWork]] (e.g. [[NewsArticle]]) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the [[CreativeWork]].

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a [[funder]]) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

anyOf.title: CreativeWork
anyOf.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

anyOf.title: Comment
anyOf.description: A comment on an item - for example, a comment on a blog post. The comment's content is expressed via the [[text]] property, and its topic via [[about]], properties shared with all CreativeWorks.

anyOf.title: Clip
anyOf.description: A short TV or radio program or a segment/part of a program.

anyOf.title: AudioObject
anyOf.description: An audio file.

anyOf.title: MusicRecording
anyOf.description: A music recording (track), usually a single song.

anyOf.title: Clip
anyOf.description: A short TV or radio program or a segment/part of a program.

anyOf.title: VideoObject
anyOf.description: A video file.

schema:sourceOrganization.title: sourceOrganization
schema:sourceOrganization.description: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

schema:translator.title: translator
schema:translator.description: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

schema:position.title: position
schema:position.description: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

anyOf.title: Integer
anyOf.description: Data type: Integer.

schema:translationOfWork.title: translationOfWork
schema:translationOfWork.description: The work that this work has been translated from. e.g. 物种起源 is a translationOf “On the Origin of Species”

anyOf.title: CreativeWork
anyOf.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

schema:isBasedOn.title: isBasedOn
schema:isBasedOn.description: A resource from which this work is derived or from which it is a modification or adaption.

anyOf.title: Product
anyOf.description: Any offered product or service. For example: a pair of shoes; a concert ticket; the rental of a car; a haircut; or an episode of a TV show streamed online.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

anyOf.title: CreativeWork
anyOf.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

schema:schemaVersion.title: schemaVersion
schema:schemaVersion.description:
Indicates (by URL or string) a particular version of a schema used in some CreativeWork. This property was created primarily to
    indicate the use of a specific schema.org release, e.g. ```10.0``` as a simple string, or more explicitly via URL, ```https://schema.org/docs/releases.html#v10.0```. There may be situations in which other schemas might usefully be referenced this way, e.g. ```http://dublincore.org/specifications/dublin-core/dces/1999-07-02/``` but this has not been carefully explored in the community.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:countryOfOrigin.title: countryOfOrigin
schema:countryOfOrigin.description:
The country of origin of something, including products as well as creative  works such as movie and TV content.

In the case of TV and movie, this would be the country of the principle offices of the production company or individual responsible for the movie. For other kinds of [[CreativeWork]] it is difficult to provide fully general guidance, and properties such as [[contentLocation]] and [[locationCreated]] may be more applicable.

In the case of products, the country of origin of the product. The exact interpretation of this may vary by context and product type, and cannot be fully enumerated here.

anyOf.title: Country
anyOf.description: A country.

schema:editEIDR.title: editEIDR
schema:editEIDR.description:
An [EIDR](https://eidr.org/) (Entertainment Identifier Registry) [[identifier]] representing a specific edit / edition for a work of film or television.

For example, the motion picture known as "Ghostbusters" whose [[titleEIDR]] is "10.5240/7EC7-228A-510A-053E-CBB8-J", has several edits e.g. "10.5240/1F2A-E1C5-680A-14C6-E76B-I" and "10.5240/8A35-3BEE-6497-5D12-9E4F-3".

Since schema.org types like [[Movie]] and [[TVEpisode]] can be used for both works and their multiple expressions, it is possible to use [[titleEIDR]] alone (for a general description), or alongside [[editEIDR]] for a more edit-specific description.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:sdPublisher.title: sdPublisher
schema:sdPublisher.description:
Indicates the party responsible for generating and publishing the current structured data markup, typically in cases where the structured data is derived automatically from existing published content but published on a different site. For example, student projects and open data initiatives often re-publish existing content with more explicitly structured metadata. The
[[sdPublisher]] property helps make such practices more explicit.

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

schema:license.title: license
schema:license.description: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

anyOf.title: CreativeWork
anyOf.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:interactionStatistic.title: interactionStatistic
schema:interactionStatistic.description: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication. The most specific child type of InteractionCounter should be used.

anyOf.title: InteractionCounter
anyOf.description: A summary of how users have interacted with this CreativeWork. In most cases, authors will use a subtype to specify the specific type of interaction.

schema:accessibilityFeature.title: accessibilityFeature
schema:accessibilityFeature.description: Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility ([WebSchemas wiki lists possible values](http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Accessibility)).

schema:mentions.title: mentions
schema:mentions.description: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.

anyOf.title: Thing
anyOf.description: The most generic type of item.

schema:temporal.title: temporal
schema:temporal.description:
The "temporal" property can be used in cases where more specific properties
(e.g. [[temporalCoverage]], [[dateCreated]], [[dateModified]], [[datePublished]]) are not known to be appropriate.

schema:usageInfo.title: usageInfo
schema:usageInfo.description:
The schema.org [[usageInfo]] property indicates further information about a [[CreativeWork]]. This property is applicable both to works that are freely available and to those that require payment or other transactions. It can reference additional information e.g. community expectations on preferred linking and citation conventions, as well as purchasing details. For something that can be commercially licensed, usageInfo can provide detailed, resource-specific information about licensing options.

This property can be used alongside the license property which indicates license(s) applicable to some piece of content. The usageInfo property can provide information about other licensing options, e.g. acquiring commercial usage rights for an image that is also available under non-commercial creative commons licenses.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

anyOf.title: CreativeWork
anyOf.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

schema:creativeWorkStatus.title: creativeWorkStatus
schema:creativeWorkStatus.description: The status of a creative work in terms of its stage in a lifecycle. Example terms include Incomplete, Draft, Published, Obsolete. Some organizations define a set of terms for the stages of their publication lifecycle.

anyOf.title: DefinedTerm
anyOf.description: A word, name, acronym, phrase, etc. with a formal definition. Often used in the context of category or subject classification, glossaries or dictionaries, product or creative work types, etc. Use the name property for the term being defined, use termCode if the term has an alpha-numeric code allocated, use description to provide the definition of the term.

schema:publisher.title: publisher
schema:publisher.description: The publisher of the creative work.

schema:alternativeHeadline.title: alternativeHeadline
schema:alternativeHeadline.description: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.

schema:sdLicense.title: sdLicense

anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

schema:copyrightNotice.title: copyrightNotice
schema:copyrightNotice.description: Text of a notice appropriate for describing the copyright aspects of this Creative Work, ideally indicating the owner of the copyright for the Work.

schema:teaches.title: teaches
schema:teaches.description: The item being described is intended to help a person learn the competency or learning outcome defined by the referenced term.

anyOf.title: DefinedTerm

schema:exampleOfWork.title: exampleOfWork
schema:exampleOfWork.description: A creative work that this work is an example/instance/realization/derivation of.

anyOf.title: CreativeWork
anyOf.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

schema:recordedAt.title: recordedAt
schema:recordedAt.description: The Event where the CreativeWork was recorded. The CreativeWork may capture all or part of the event.

anyOf.title: Event
anyOf.description: An event happening at a certain time and location, such as a concert, lecture, or festival. Ticketing information may be added via the [[offers]] property. Repeated events may be structured as separate Event objects.

schema:conditionsOfAccess.title: conditionsOfAccess
schema:conditionsOfAccess.description: Conditions that affect the availability of, or method(s) of access to, an item. Typically used for real world items such as an [[ArchiveComponent]] held by an [[ArchiveOrganization]]. This property is not suitable for use as a general Web access control mechanism. It is expressed only in natural language.\n\nFor example "Available by appointment from the Reading Room" or "Accessible only from logged-in accounts ".

schema:size.title: size
schema:size.description: A standardized size of a product or creative work, specified either through a simple textual string (for example 'XL', '32Wx34L'), a  QuantitativeValue with a unitCode, or a comprehensive and structured [[SizeSpecification]]; in other cases, the [[width]], [[height]], [[depth]] and [[weight]] properties may be more applicable.

anyOf.title: QuantitativeValue
anyOf.description: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

anyOf.title: DefinedTerm
anyOf.description: A word, name, acronym, phrase, etc. with a formal definition. Often used in the context of category or subject classification, glossaries or dictionaries, product or creative work types, etc. Use the name property for the term being defined, use termCode if the term has an alpha-numeric code allocated, use description to provide the definition of the term.

anyOf.title: SizeSpecification
anyOf.description: Size related properties of a product, typically a size code ([[name]]) and optionally a [[sizeSystem]], [[sizeGroup]], and product measurements ([[hasMeasurement]]). In addition, the intended audience can be defined through [[suggestedAge]], [[suggestedGender]], and suggested body measurements ([[suggestedMeasurement]]).

schema:workExample.title: workExample
schema:workExample.description: Example/instance/realization/derivation of the concept of this creative work. eg. The paperback edition, first edition, or eBook.

anyOf.title: CreativeWork
anyOf.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

schema:accessibilityHazard.title: accessibilityHazard
schema:accessibilityHazard.description: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3 ([WebSchemas wiki lists possible values](http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Accessibility)).

schema:copyrightYear.title: copyrightYear
schema:copyrightYear.description: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.

schema:encodings.title: encodings
schema:encodings.description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork.

anyOf.title: MediaObject
anyOf.description: A media object, such as an image, video, or audio object embedded in a web page or a downloadable dataset i.e. DataDownload. Note that a creative work may have many media objects associated with it on the same web page. For example, a page about a single song (MusicRecording) may have a music video (VideoObject), and a high and low bandwidth audio stream (2 AudioObject's).

schema:creator.title: creator
schema:creator.description: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

schema:accessMode.title: accessMode
schema:accessMode.description: The human sensory perceptual system or cognitive faculty through which a person may process or perceive information. Expected values include: auditory, tactile, textual, visual, colorDependent, chartOnVisual, chemOnVisual, diagramOnVisual, mathOnVisual, musicOnVisual, textOnVisual.

schema:abstract.title: abstract
schema:abstract.description: An abstract is a short description that summarizes a [[CreativeWork]].

schema:thumbnailUrl.title: thumbnailUrl
schema:thumbnailUrl.description: A thumbnail image relevant to the Thing.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:acquireLicensePage.title: acquireLicensePage
schema:acquireLicensePage.description: Indicates a page documenting how licenses can be purchased or otherwise acquired, for the current item.

schema:contentRating.description: Official rating of a piece of content—for example,'MPAA PG-13'.

anyOf.title: Rating
anyOf.description: A rating is an evaluation on a numeric scale, such as 1 to 5 stars.

schema:awards.title: awards
schema:awards.description: Awards won by or for this item.

schema:isFamilyFriendly.title: isFamilyFriendly
schema:isFamilyFriendly.description: Indicates whether this content is family friendly.

schema:editor.title: editor
schema:editor.description: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

schema:educationalLevel.title: educationalLevel
schema:educationalLevel.description: The level in terms of progression through an educational or training context. Examples of educational levels include 'beginner', 'intermediate' or 'advanced', and formal sets of level indicators.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

anyOf.title: DefinedTerm

Often used in the context of category or subject classification, glossaries or dictionaries, product or creative work types, etc. Use the name property for the term being defined, use termCode if the term has an alpha-numeric code allocated, use description to provide the definition of the term.

schema:assesses.title: assesses
schema:assesses.description: The item being described is intended to assess the competency or learning outcome defined by the referenced term.

schema:mainEntity.title: mainEntity
schema:mainEntity.description: Indicates the primary entity described in some page or other CreativeWork.

anyOf.title: Thing
anyOf.description: The most generic type of item.

schema:correction.title: correction
schema:correction.description: Indicates a correction to a [[CreativeWork]], either via a [[CorrectionComment]], textually or in another document.

anyOf.title: CorrectionComment
anyOf.description: A [[comment]] that corrects [[CreativeWork]].

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:timeRequired.title: timeRequired
schema:timeRequired.description: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience, e.g. 'PT30M', 'PT1H25M'.

anyOf.title: Duration
anyOf.description: Quantity: Duration (use [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

schema:keywords.title: keywords
schema:keywords.description: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

anyOf.title: DefinedTerm
anyOf.description: A word, name, acronym, phrase, etc. with a formal definition. Often used in the context of category or subject classification, glossaries or dictionaries, product or creative work types, etc. Use the name property for the term being defined, use termCode if the term has an alpha-numeric code allocated, use description to provide the definition of the term.

schema:audience.title: audience
schema:audience.description: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

anyOf.title: Audience
anyOf.description: Intended audience for an item, i.e. the group for whom the item was created.

schema:sponsor.title: sponsor
schema:sponsor.description: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

schema:educationalUse.title: educationalUse
schema:educationalUse.description: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.

anyOf.title: DefinedTerm
anyOf.description: A word, name, acronym, phrase, etc. with a formal definition. Often used in the context of category or subject classification, glossaries or dictionaries, product or creative work types, etc. Use the name property for the term being defined, use termCode if the term has an alpha-numeric code allocated, use description to provide the definition of the term.

schema:sdDatePublished.title: sdDatePublished
schema:sdDatePublished.description: Indicates the date on which the current structured data was generated / published. Typically used alongside [[sdPublisher]]

schema:spatialCoverage.title: spatialCoverage
schema:spatialCoverage.description:
The spatialCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the place(s) which are the focus of the content. It is a subproperty of
      contentLocation intended primarily for more technical and detailed materials. For example with a Dataset, it indicates
      areas that the dataset describes: a dataset of New York weather would have spatialCoverage which was the place: the state of New York.

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

schema:material.title: material
schema:material.description: A material that something is made from, e.g. leather, wool, cotton, paper.

anyOf.title: Product
anyOf.description: Any offered product or service. For example: a pair of shoes; a concert ticket; the rental of a car; a haircut; or an episode of a TV show streamed online.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:publication.title: publication
schema:publication.description: A publication event associated with the item.

anyOf.title: PublicationEvent
anyOf.description: A PublicationEvent corresponds indifferently to the event of publication for a CreativeWork of any type e.g. a broadcast event, an on-demand event, a book/journal publication via a variety of delivery media.

schema:encodingFormat.title: encodingFormat
schema:encodingFormat.description:
Media type typically expressed using a MIME format (see [IANA site](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml) and [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types)) e.g. application/zip for a SoftwareApplication binary, audio/mpeg for .mp3 etc.).

In cases where a [[CreativeWork]] has several media type representations, [[encoding]] can be used to indicate each [[MediaObject]] alongside particular [[encodingFormat]] information.

Unregistered or niche encoding and file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia/Wikidata entry.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:inLanguage.title: inLanguage
schema:inLanguage.description: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

anyOf.title: Language
anyOf.description: Natural languages such as Spanish, Tamil, Hindi, English, etc. Formal language code tags expressed in [BCP 47](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) can be used via the [[alternateName]] property. The Language type previously also covered programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, which are now best represented using [[ComputerLanguage]].

schema:dateModified.title: dateModified
schema:dateModified.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

anyOf.title: Review
anyOf.description: A review of an item - for example, of a restaurant, movie, or store.

schema:dateCreated.title: dateCreated
schema:dateCreated.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

schema:associatedMedia.title: associatedMedia
schema:associatedMedia.description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.

anyOf.title: MediaObject
anyOf.description: A media object, such as an image, video, or audio object embedded in a web page or a downloadable dataset i.e. DataDownload. Note that a creative work may have many media objects associated with it on the same web page. For example, a page about a single song (MusicRecording) may have a music video (VideoObject), and a high and low bandwidth audio stream (2 AudioObject's).

schema:interpretedAsClaim.title: interpretedAsClaim
schema:interpretedAsClaim.description: Used to indicate a specific claim contained, implied, translated or refined from the content of a [[MediaObject]] or other [[CreativeWork]]. The interpreting party can be indicated using [[claimInterpreter]].

anyOf.title: Claim
anyOf.description:
A [[Claim]] in Schema.org represents a specific, factually-oriented claim that could be the [[itemReviewed]] in a [[ClaimReview]]. The content of a claim can be summarized with the [[text]] property. Variations on well known claims can have their common identity indicated via [[sameAs]] links, and summarized with a [[name]]. Ideally, a [[Claim]] description includes enough contextual information to minimize the risk of ambiguity or inclarity. In practice, many claims are better understood in the context in which they appear or the interpretations provided by claim reviews.

  Beyond [[ClaimReview]], the Claim type can be associated with related creative works - for example a [[ScholarlyArticle]] or [[Question]] might be [[about]] some [[Claim]].

  At this time, Schema.org does not define any types of relationship between claims. This is a natural area for future exploration.

anyOf.title: Review
anyOf.description: A review of an item - for example, of a restaurant, movie, or store.

schema:publisherImprint.title: publisherImprint
schema:publisherImprint.description: The publishing division which published the comic.

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

schema:accessibilityAPI.title: accessibilityAPI
schema:accessibilityAPI.description: Indicates that the resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility API ([WebSchemas wiki lists possible values](http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Accessibility)).

schema:version.title: version
schema:version.description: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

schema:learningResourceType.title: learningResourceType
schema:learningResourceType.description: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.

anyOf.title: DefinedTerm
anyOf.description: A word, name, acronym, phrase, etc. with a formal definition. Often used in the context of category or subject classification, glossaries or dictionaries, product or creative work types, etc. Use the name property for the term being defined, use termCode if the term has an alpha-numeric code allocated, use description to provide the definition of the term.

schema:discussionUrl.title: discussionUrl
schema:discussionUrl.description: A link to the page containing the comments of the CreativeWork.

anyOf.title: URL

schema:provider.title: provider
schema:provider.description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

schema:fileFormat.title: fileFormat
schema:fileFormat.description: Media type, typically MIME format (see [IANA site](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml)) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information. Unregistered or niche file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia entry.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:producer.title: producer
schema:producer.description: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

schema:citation.title: citation
schema:citation.description: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

anyOf.title: CreativeWork
anyOf.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

schema:archivedAt.title: archivedAt
schema:archivedAt.description: Indicates a page or other link involved in archival of a [[CreativeWork]]. In the case of [[MediaReview]], the items in a [[MediaReviewItem]] may often become inaccessible, but be archived by archival, journalistic, activist, or law enforcement organizations. In such cases, the referenced page may not directly publish the content.

anyOf.title: WebPage
anyOf.description: A web page. Every web page is implicitly assumed to be declared to be of type WebPage, so the various properties about that webpage, such as breadcrumb may be used. We recommend explicit declaration if these properties are specified, but if they are found outside of an itemscope, they will be assumed to be about the page.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:encoding.title: encoding
schema:encoding.description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for associatedMedia.

anyOf.title: MediaObject
anyOf.description: A media object, such as an image, video, or audio object embedded in a web page or a downloadable dataset i.e. DataDownload. Note that a creative work may have many media objects associated with it on the same web page. For example, a page about a single song (MusicRecording) may have a music video (VideoObject), and a high and low bandwidth audio stream (2 AudioObject's).

schema:interactivityType.title: interactivityType
schema:interactivityType.description: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.

schema:spatial.title: spatial
schema:spatial.description:
The "spatial" property can be used in cases when more specific properties
(e.g. [[locationCreated]], [[spatialCoverage]], [[contentLocation]]) are not known to be appropriate.

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

schema:contentLocation.description: The location depicted or described in the content. For example, the location in a photograph or painting.
