schema:audience.title: audience
schema:audience.description: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

anyOf.title: Audience
anyOf.description: Intended audience for an item, i.e. the group for whom the item was created.

schema:serviceArea.title: serviceArea
schema:serviceArea.description: The geographic area where the service is provided.

anyOf.title: AdministrativeArea
anyOf.description: A geographical region, typically under the jurisdiction of a particular government.

anyOf.title: GeoShape
anyOf.description: The geographic shape of a place. A GeoShape can be described using several properties whose values are based on latitude/longitude pairs. Either whitespace or commas can be used to separate latitude and longitude; whitespace should be used when writing a list of several such points.

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

schema:hasOfferCatalog.title: hasOfferCatalog
schema:hasOfferCatalog.description: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

anyOf.title: OfferCatalog
anyOf.description: An OfferCatalog is an ItemList that contains related Offers and/or further OfferCatalogs that are offeredBy the same provider.

schema:isRelatedTo.title: isRelatedTo
schema:isRelatedTo.description: A pointer to another, somehow related product (or multiple products).

anyOf.title: Product
anyOf.description: Any offered product or service. For example: a pair of shoes; a concert ticket; the rental of a car; a haircut; or an episode of a TV show streamed online.

anyOf.title: Service
anyOf.description: A service provided by an organization, e.g. delivery service, print services, etc.

schema:hoursAvailable.title: hoursAvailable
schema:hoursAvailable.description: The hours during which this service or contact is available.

anyOf.title: OpeningHoursSpecification
anyOf.description:
A structured value providing information about the opening hours of a place or a certain service inside a place.


The place is __open__ if the [[opens]] property is specified, and __closed__ otherwise.

If the value for the [[closes]] property is less than the value for the [[opens]] property then the hour range is assumed to span over the next day.

anyOf.title: Review
anyOf.description: A review of an item - for example, of a restaurant, movie, or store.

schema:provider.title: provider
schema:provider.description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

schema:availableChannel.title: availableChannel
schema:availableChannel.description: A means of accessing the service (e.g. a phone bank, a web site, a location, etc.).

anyOf.title: ServiceChannel
anyOf.description: A means for accessing a service, e.g. a government office location, web site, or phone number.

schema:broker.title: broker
schema:broker.description: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

schema:serviceAudience.title: serviceAudience
schema:serviceAudience.description: The audience eligible for this service.

anyOf.title: Audience
anyOf.description: Intended audience for an item, i.e. the group for whom the item was created.

schema:audienceType.title: audienceType
schema:audienceType.description: The target group associated with a given audience (e.g. veterans, car owners, musicians, etc.).

schema:geographicArea.title: geographicArea
schema:geographicArea.description: The geographic area associated with the audience.

anyOf.title: AdministrativeArea
anyOf.description: A geographical region, typically under the jurisdiction of a particular government.

schema:opens.title: opens
schema:opens.description: The opening hour of the place or service on the given day(s) of the week.

schema:validFrom.title: validFrom
schema:validFrom.description: The date when the item becomes valid.

schema:validThrough.title: validThrough
schema:validThrough.description: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

schema:closes.title: closes
schema:closes.description: The closing hour of the place or service on the given day(s) of the week.

schema:dayOfWeek.title: dayOfWeek
schema:dayOfWeek.description: The day of the week for which these opening hours are valid.

anyOf.title: DayOfWeek
anyOf.description:
The day of the week, e.g. used to specify to which day the opening hours of an OpeningHoursSpecification refer.

Originally, URLs from [GoodRelations](http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1) were used (for [[Monday]], [[Tuesday]], [[Wednesday]], [[Thursday]], [[Friday]], [[Saturday]], [[Sunday]] plus a special entry for [[PublicHolidays]]); these have now been integrated directly into schema.org.

schema:processingTime.title: processingTime
schema:processingTime.description: Estimated processing time for the service using this channel.

anyOf.title: Duration
anyOf.description: Quantity: Duration (use [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

schema:serviceLocation.title: serviceLocation
schema:serviceLocation.description: The location (e.g. civic structure, local business, etc.) where a person can go to access the service.

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

schema:servicePostalAddress.title: servicePostalAddress
schema:servicePostalAddress.description: The address for accessing the service by mail.

anyOf.title: PostalAddress
anyOf.description: The mailing address.

schema:serviceUrl.title: serviceUrl
schema:serviceUrl.description: The website to access the service.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:providesService.title: providesService
schema:providesService.description: The service provided by this channel.

anyOf.title: Service
anyOf.description: A service provided by an organization, e.g. delivery service, print services, etc.

schema:serviceSmsNumber.title: serviceSmsNumber
schema:serviceSmsNumber.description: The number to access the service by text message.

anyOf.title: ContactPoint
anyOf.description: A contact point—for example, a Customer Complaints department.

schema:servicePhone.title: servicePhone
schema:servicePhone.description: The phone number to use to access the service.

anyOf.title: ContactPoint
anyOf.description: A contact point—for example, a Customer Complaints department.

schema:availableLanguage.title: availableLanguage
schema:availableLanguage.description: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]]

anyOf.title: Language
anyOf.description: Natural languages such as Spanish, Tamil, Hindi, English, etc. Formal language code tags expressed in [BCP 47](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) can be used via the [[alternateName]] property. The Language type previously also covered programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, which are now best represented using [[ComputerLanguage]].

schema:exceptDate.title: exceptDate
schema:exceptDate.description:
Defines a [[Date]] or [[DateTime]] during which a scheduled [[Event]] will not take place. The property allows exceptions to
      a [[Schedule]] to be specified. If an exception is specified as a [[DateTime]] then only the event that would have started at that specific date and time
      should be excluded from the schedule. If an exception is specified as a [[Date]] then any event that is scheduled for that 24 hour period should be
      excluded from the schedule. This allows a whole day to be excluded from the schedule without having to itemise every scheduled event.

schema:scheduleTimezone.title: scheduleTimezone
schema:scheduleTimezone.description: Indicates the timezone for which the time(s) indicated in the [[Schedule]] are given. The value provided should be among those listed in the IANA Time Zone Database.

schema:byDay.title: byDay
schema:byDay.description: Defines the day(s) of the week on which a recurring [[Event]] takes place. May be specified using either [[DayOfWeek]], or alternatively [[Text]] conforming to iCal's syntax for byDay recurrence rules.

anyOf.title: DayOfWeek
anyOf.description:
The day of the week, e.g. used to specify to which day the opening hours of an OpeningHoursSpecification refer.

Originally, URLs from [GoodRelations](http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1) were used (for [[Monday]], [[Tuesday]], [[Wednesday]], [[Thursday]], [[Friday]], [[Saturday]], [[Sunday]] plus a special entry for [[PublicHolidays]]); these have now been integrated directly into schema.org.

schema:byMonthDay.title: byMonthDay
schema:byMonthDay.description: Defines the day(s) of the month on which a recurring [[Event]] takes place. Specified as an [[Integer]] between 1-31.

anyOf.title: Integer
anyOf.description: Data type: Integer.

schema:duration.title: duration
schema:duration.description: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

anyOf.title: Duration
anyOf.description: Quantity: Duration (use [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

schema:repeatCount.title: repeatCount
schema:repeatCount.description: Defines the number of times a recurring [[Event]] will take place

anyOf.title: Integer
anyOf.description: Data type: Integer.

schema:endTime.title: endTime
schema:endTime.description: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the end of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

schema:endDate.title: endDate
schema:endDate.description: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

schema:repeatFrequency.title: repeatFrequency
schema:repeatFrequency.description:
Defines the frequency at which [[Event]]s will occur according to a schedule [[Schedule]]. The intervals between
      events should be defined as a [[Duration]] of time.

anyOf.title: Duration
anyOf.description: Quantity: Duration (use [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

schema:byMonthWeek.title: byMonthWeek
schema:byMonthWeek.description: Defines the week(s) of the month on which a recurring Event takes place. Specified as an Integer between 1-5. For clarity, byMonthWeek is best used in conjunction with byDay to indicate concepts like the first and third Mondays of a month.

anyOf.title: Integer
anyOf.description: Data type: Integer.

schema:byMonth.title: byMonth
schema:byMonth.description: Defines the month(s) of the year on which a recurring [[Event]] takes place. Specified as an [[Integer]] between 1-12. January is 1.

anyOf.title: Integer
anyOf.description: Data type: Integer.

schema:startDate.title: startDate
schema:startDate.description: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

schema:startTime.title: startTime
schema:startTime.description: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the start of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

schema:sizeSystem.title: sizeSystem
schema:sizeSystem.description: The size system used to identify a product's size. Typically either a standard (for example, "GS1" or "ISO-EN13402"), country code (for example "US" or "JP"), or a measuring system (for example "Metric" or "Imperial").

anyOf.title: SizeSystemEnumeration
anyOf.description: Enumerates common size systems for different categories of products, for example "EN-13402" or "UK" for wearables or "Imperial" for screws.

schema:hasMeasurement.title: hasMeasurement
schema:hasMeasurement.description: A product measurement, for example the inseam of pants, the wheel size of a bicycle, or the gauge of a screw. Usually an exact measurement, but can also be a range of measurements for adjustable products, for example belts and ski bindings.

anyOf.title: QuantitativeValue
anyOf.description: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

schema:suggestedGender.title: suggestedGender
schema:suggestedGender.description: The suggested gender of the intended person or audience, for example "male", "female", or "unisex".

anyOf.title: GenderType
anyOf.description: An enumeration of genders.

schema:sizeGroup.title: sizeGroup
schema:sizeGroup.description: The size group (also known as "size type") for a product's size. Size groups are common in the fashion industry to define size segments and suggested audiences for wearable products. Multiple values can be combined, for example "men's big and tall", "petite maternity" or "regular"

anyOf.title: SizeGroupEnumeration
anyOf.description: Enumerates common size groups for various product categories.

schema:suggestedAge.title: suggestedAge
schema:suggestedAge.description: The age or age range for the intended audience or person, for example 3-12 months for infants, 1-5 years for toddlers.

anyOf.title: QuantitativeValue
anyOf.description: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

schema:suggestedMeasurement.title: suggestedMeasurement
schema:suggestedMeasurement.description: A suggested range of body measurements for the intended audience or person, for example inseam between 32 and 34 inches or height between 170 and 190 cm. Typically found on a size chart for wearable products.

anyOf.title: QuantitativeValue
anyOf.description: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

schema:significantLink.title: significantLink
schema:significantLink.description: One of the more significant URLs on the page. Typically, these are the non-navigation links that are clicked on the most.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:speakable.title: speakable
schema:speakable.description:
Indicates sections of a Web page that are particularly 'speakable' in the sense of being highlighted as being especially appropriate for text-to-speech conversion. Other sections of a page may also be usefully spoken in particular circumstances; the 'speakable' property serves to indicate the parts most likely to be generally useful for speech.

The *speakable* property can be repeated an arbitrary number of times, with three kinds of possible 'content-locator' values:

1.) *id-value* URL references - uses *id-value* of an element in the page being annotated. The simplest use of *speakable* has (potentially relative) URL values, referencing identified sections of the document concerned.

2.) CSS Selectors - addresses content in the annotated page, eg. via class attribute. Use the [[cssSelector]] property.

3.)  XPaths - addresses content via XPaths (assuming an XML view of the content). Use the [[xpath]] property.


For more sophisticated markup of speakable sections beyond simple ID references, either CSS selectors or XPath expressions to pick out document section(s) as speakable. For this
we define a supporting type, [[SpeakableSpecification]]  which is defined to be a possible value of the *speakable* property.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

anyOf.title: SpeakableSpecification
anyOf.description: A SpeakableSpecification indicates (typically via [[xpath]] or [[cssSelector]]) sections of a document that are highlighted as particularly [[speakable]]. Instances of this type are expected to be used primarily as values of the [[speakable]] property.

schema:significantLinks.title: significantLinks
schema:significantLinks.description: The most significant URLs on the page. Typically, these are the non-navigation links that are clicked on the most.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:relatedLink.title: relatedLink
schema:relatedLink.description: A link related to this web page, for example to other related web pages.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:reviewedBy.title: reviewedBy
schema:reviewedBy.description: People or organizations that have reviewed the content on this web page for accuracy and/or completeness.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

schema:breadcrumb.title: breadcrumb
schema:breadcrumb.description: A set of links that can help a user understand and navigate a website hierarchy.

anyOf.title: BreadcrumbList
anyOf.description: A BreadcrumbList is an ItemList consisting of a chain of linked Web pages, typically described using at least their URL and their name, and typically ending with the current page.\n\nThe [[position]] property is used to reconstruct the order of the items in a BreadcrumbList The convention is that a breadcrumb list has an [[itemListOrder]] of [[ItemListOrderAscending]] (lower values listed first), and that the first items in this list correspond to the "top" or beginning of the breadcrumb trail, e.g. with a site or section homepage. The specific values of 'position' are not assigned meaning for a BreadcrumbList, but they should be integers, e.g. beginning with '1' for the first item in the list.

schema:primaryImageOfPage.title: primaryImageOfPage
schema:primaryImageOfPage.description: Indicates the main image on the page.

anyOf.title: ImageObject
anyOf.description: An image file.

schema:lastReviewed.title: lastReviewed
schema:lastReviewed.description: Date on which the content on this web page was last reviewed for accuracy and/or completeness.

schema:mainContentOfPage.title: mainContentOfPage
schema:mainContentOfPage.description: Indicates if this web page element is the main subject of the page.

anyOf.title: WebPageElement
anyOf.description: A web page element, like a table or an image.

schema:specialty.title: specialty
schema:specialty.description: One of the domain specialities to which this web page's content applies.

anyOf.title: Specialty
anyOf.description: Any branch of a field in which people typically develop specific expertise, usually after significant study, time, and effort.

schema:xpath.title: xpath
schema:xpath.description: An XPath, e.g. of a [[SpeakableSpecification]] or [[WebPageElement]]. In the latter case, multiple matches within a page can constitute a single conceptual "Web page element".

anyOf.title: XPathType
anyOf.description: Text representing an XPath (typically but not necessarily version 1.0).

schema:cssSelector.title: cssSelector
schema:cssSelector.description: A CSS selector, e.g. of a [[SpeakableSpecification]] or [[WebPageElement]]. In the latter case, multiple matches within a page can constitute a single conceptual "Web page element".

anyOf.title: CssSelectorType
anyOf.description: Text representing a CSS selector.

schema:measurementTechnique.title: measurementTechnique
schema:measurementTechnique.description:
A technique or technology used in a [[Dataset]] (or [[DataDownload]], [[DataCatalog]]),
corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s) (described using [[variableMeasured]]). This is oriented towards scientific and scholarly dataset publication but may have broader applicability; it is not intended as a full representation of measurement, but rather as a high level summary for dataset discovery.

For example, if [[variableMeasured]] is: molecule concentration, [[measurementTechnique]] could be: "mass spectrometry" or "nmr spectroscopy" or "colorimetry" or "immunofluorescence".

If the [[variableMeasured]] is "depression rating", the [[measurementTechnique]] could be "Zung Scale" or "HAM-D" or "Beck Depression Inventory".

If there are several [[variableMeasured]] properties recorded for some given data object, use a [[PropertyValue]] for each [[variableMeasured]] and attach the corresponding [[measurementTechnique]].

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:issn.title: issn
schema:issn.description: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) that identifies this serial publication. You can repeat this property to identify different formats of, or the linking ISSN (ISSN-L) for, this serial publication.

schema:customerRemorseReturnFees.title: customerRemorseReturnFees
schema:customerRemorseReturnFees.description: The type of return fees if the product is returned due to customer remorse.

anyOf.title: ReturnFeesEnumeration
anyOf.description: Enumerates several kinds of policies for product return fees.

schema:customerRemorseReturnShippingFees.title: customerRemorseReturnShippingFeesAmount
schema:customerRemorseReturnShippingFees.description: The amount of shipping costs if a product is returned due to customer remorse. Applicable when property [[customerRemorseReturnFees]] equals [[ReturnShippingFees]].

anyOf.title: MonetaryAmount
anyOf.description: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use [[PriceSpecification]] Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

schema:inStoreReturnsOffered.title: inStoreReturnsOffered
schema:inStoreReturnsOffered.description: Are in-store returns offered? (for more advanced return methods use the [[returnMethod]] property)

schema:itemDefectReturnShippingFeesAmoun.title: itemDefectReturnShippingFeesAmount
schema:itemDefectReturnShippingFeesAmoun.description: Amount of shipping costs for defect product returns. Applicable when property [[itemDefectReturnFees]] equals [[ReturnShippingFees]].

anyOf.title: MonetaryAmount
anyOf.description: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use [[PriceSpecification]] Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

schema:returnFees.title: returnFees
schema:returnFees.description: The type of return fees for purchased products (for any return reason)

anyOf.title: ReturnFeesEnumeration
anyOf.description: Enumerates several kinds of policies for product return fees.

schema:merchantReturnLink.title: merchantReturnLink
schema:merchantReturnLink.description: Specifies a Web page or service by URL, for product returns.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:itemDefectReturnLabelSource.title: itemDefectReturnLabelSource
schema:itemDefectReturnLabelSource.description: The method (from an enumeration) by which the customer obtains a return shipping label for a defect product.

anyOf.title: ReturnLabelSourceEnumeration
anyOf.description: Enumerates several types of return labels for product returns.

schema:merchantReturnDays.title: merchantReturnDays
schema:merchantReturnDays.description: Specifies either a fixed return date or the number of days (from the delivery date) that a product can be returned. Used when the [[returnPolicyCategory]] property is specified as [[MerchantReturnFiniteReturnWindow]].

anyOf.title: Integer
anyOf.description: Data type: Integer.

schema:returnLabelSource.title: returnLabelSource
schema:returnLabelSource.description: The method (from an enumeration) by which the customer obtains a return shipping label for a product returned for any reason.

anyOf.title: ReturnLabelSourceEnumeration
anyOf.description: Enumerates several types of return labels for product returns.

schema:returnPolicySeasonalOverride.title: returnPolicySeasonalOverride
schema:returnPolicySeasonalOverride.description: Seasonal override of a return policy.

anyOf.title: MerchantReturnPolicySeasonalOverride
anyOf.description: A seasonal override of a return policy, for example used for holidays.

schema:refundType.title: refundType
schema:refundType.description: A refund type, from an enumerated list.

anyOf.title: RefundTypeEnumeration
anyOf.description: Enumerates several kinds of product return refund types.

schema:returnPolicyCategory.title: returnPolicyCategory
schema:returnPolicyCategory.description: Specifies an applicable return policy (from an enumeration).

anyOf.title: MerchantReturnEnumeration
anyOf.description: Enumerates several kinds of product return policies.

schema:returnPolicyCountry.title: returnPolicyCountry
schema:returnPolicyCountry.description: The country where the product has to be sent to for returns, for example "Ireland" using the [[name]] property of [[Country]]. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1). Note that this can be different from the country where the product was originally shipped from or sent too.

anyOf.title: Country
anyOf.description: A country.

schema:itemDefectReturnFees.title: itemDefectReturnFees
schema:itemDefectReturnFees.description: The type of return fees for returns of defect products.

anyOf.title: ReturnFeesEnumeration
anyOf.description: Enumerates several kinds of policies for product return fees.

schema:returnMethod.title: returnMethod
schema:returnMethod.description: The type of return method offered, specified from an enumeration.

anyOf.title: ReturnMethodEnumeration
anyOf.description: Enumerates several types of product return methods.

schema:itemCondition.title: itemCondition
schema:itemCondition.description: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition specifying the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer. Also used for product return policies to specify the condition of products accepted for returns.

anyOf.title: OfferItemCondition
anyOf.description: A list of possible conditions for the item.

schema:restockingFee.title: restockingFee
schema:restockingFee.description: Use [[MonetaryAmount]] to specify a fixed restocking fee for product returns, or use [[Number]] to specify a percentage of the product price paid by the customer.

anyOf.title: MonetaryAmount
anyOf.description: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use [[PriceSpecification]] Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

schema:additionalProperty.title: additionalProperty
schema:additionalProperty.description: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. https://schema.org/width, https://schema.org/color, https://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

anyOf.title: PropertyValue
anyOf.description: A property-value pair, e.g. representing a feature of a product or place. Use the 'name' property for the name of the property. If there is an additional human-readable version of the value, put that into the 'description' property.\n\n Always use specific schema.org properties when a) they exist and b) you can populate them. Using PropertyValue as a substitute will typically not trigger the same effect as using the original, specific property.

schema:returnShippingFeesAmount.title: returnShippingFeesAmount
schema:returnShippingFeesAmount.description: Amount of shipping costs for product returns (for any reason). Applicable when property [[returnFees]] equals [[ReturnShippingFees]].

anyOf.title: MonetaryAmount
anyOf.description: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use [[PriceSpecification]] Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

schema:customerRemorseReturnLabelSource.title: customerRemorseReturnLabelSource
schema:customerRemorseReturnLabelSource.description: The method (from an enumeration) by which the customer obtains a return shipping label for a product returned due to customer remorse.

anyOf.title: ReturnLabelSourceEnumeration
anyOf.description: Enumerates several types of return labels for product returns.

schema:minValue.title: minValue
schema:minValue.description: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

schema:validFrom.title: validFrom
schema:validFrom.description: The date when the item becomes valid.

schema:value.title: value
schema:value.description:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.

* For [[QuantitativeValue]] and [[MonetaryAmount]], the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
* For [[PropertyValue]], it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

anyOf.title: StructuredValue
anyOf.description: Structured values are used when the value of a property has a more complex structure than simply being a textual value or a reference to another thing.

schema:validThrough.title: validThrough
schema:validThrough.description: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

schema:maxValue.title: maxValue
schema:maxValue.description: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

schema:currency.title: currency
schema:currency.description: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

schema:merchantReturnDays.title: merchantReturnDays

anyOf.title: CreativeWorkSeries
anyOf.description:
A CreativeWorkSeries in schema.org is a group of related items, typically but not necessarily of the same kind. CreativeWorkSeries are usually organized into some order, often chronological. Unlike [[ItemList]] which is a general purpose data structure for lists of things, the emphasis with CreativeWorkSeries is on published materials (written e.g. books and periodicals, or media such as tv, radio and games).

Specific subtypes are available for describing [[TVSeries]], [[RadioSeries]], [[MovieSeries]], [[BookSeries]], [[Periodical]] and [[VideoGameSeries]]. In each case, the [[hasPart]] / [[isPartOf]] properties can be used to relate the CreativeWorkSeries to its parts. The general CreativeWorkSeries type serves largely just to organize these more specific and practical subtypes.

It is common for properties applicable to an item from the series to be usefully applied to the containing group. Schema.org attempts to anticipate some of these cases, but publishers should be free to apply properties of the series parts to the series as a whole wherever they seem appropriate.

schema:actor.title: actor
schema:actor.description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

anyOf.title: Person

schema:directors.title: directors
schema:directors.description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

schema:utterances.title: utterances
schema:utterances.description: Text of an utterances (spoken words, lyrics etc.) that occurs at a certain section of a media object, represented as a [[HyperTocEntry]].

schema:tocContinuation.title: tocContinuation
schema:tocContinuation.description: A [[HyperTocEntry]] can have a [[tocContinuation]] indicated, which is another [[HyperTocEntry]] that would be the default next item to play or render.

anyOf.title: HyperTocEntry
anyOf.description: A HyperToEntry is an item within a [[HyperToc]], which represents a hypertext table of contents for complex media objects, such as [[VideoObject]], [[AudioObject]]. The media object itself is indicated using [[associatedMedia]]. Each section of interest within that content can be described with a [[HyperTocEntry]], with associated [[startOffset]] and [[endOffset]]. When several entries are all from the same file, [[associatedMedia]] is used on the overarching [[HyperTocEntry]]; if the content has been split into multiple files, they can be referenced using [[associatedMedia]] on each [[HyperTocEntry]].

schema:associatedMedia.title: associatedMedia
schema:associatedMedia.description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.

anyOf.title: MediaObject

Note that a creative work may have many media objects associated with it on the same web page. For example, a page about a single song (MusicRecording) may have a music video (VideoObject), and a high and low bandwidth audio stream (2 AudioObject's).

schema:energyEfficiencyScaleMax.title: energyEfficiencyScaleMax
schema:energyEfficiencyScaleMax.description: Specifies the most energy efficient class on the regulated EU energy consumption scale for the product category a product belongs to. For example, energy consumption for televisions placed on the market after January 1, 2020 is scaled from D to A+++.

anyOf.title: EUEnergyEfficiencyEnumeration
anyOf.description: Enumerates the EU energy efficiency classes A-G as well as A+, A++, and A+++ as defined in EU directive 2017/1369.

schema:energyEfficiencyScaleMin.title: energyEfficiencyScaleMin
schema:energyEfficiencyScaleMin.description: Specifies the least energy efficient class on the regulated EU energy consumption scale for the product category a product belongs to. For example, energy consumption for televisions placed on the market after January 1, 2020 is scaled from D to A+++.

anyOf.title: EUEnergyEfficiencyEnumeration
anyOf.description: Enumerates the EU energy efficiency classes A-G as well as A+, A++, and A+++ as defined in EU directive 2017/1369.

anyOf.title: PriceSpecification

schema:priceCurrency.title: priceCurrency
schema:priceCurrency.description: The currency of the price, or a price component when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

schema:price.title: price
schema:price.description:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:

* Use the [[priceCurrency]] property (with standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR") instead of including [ambiguous symbols](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dollar_sign#Currencies_that_use_the_dollar_or_peso_sign) such as '$' in the value.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
* Note that both [RDFa](http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml-rdfa-primer/#using-the-content-attribute) and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Labor-BringIn
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-BringIn
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-PickUp

anyOf.title: MenuSection

schema:offers.title: offers
schema:offers.description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event. Use [[businessFunction]] to indicate the kind of transaction offered, i.e. sell, lease, etc. This property can also be used to describe a [[Demand]]. While this property is listed as expected on a number of common types, it can be used in others. In that case, using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer.

anyOf.title: Demand
anyOf.description: A demand entity represents the public, not necessarily binding, not necessarily exclusive, announcement by an organization or person to seek a certain type of goods or services. For describing demand using this type, the very same properties used for Offer apply.

anyOf.title: Offer
anyOf.description:
An offer to transfer some rights to an item or to provide a service — for example, an offer to sell tickets to an event, to rent the DVD of a movie, to stream a TV show over the internet, to repair a motorcycle, or to loan a book.

Note: As the [[businessFunction]] property, which identifies the form of offer (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose), defaults to http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell; an Offer without a defined businessFunction value can be assumed to be an offer to sell.

For [GTIN](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin)-related fields, see [Check Digit calculator](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/support/check_digit_calculator) and [validation guide](http://www.gs1us.org/resources/standards/gtin-validation-guide) from [GS1](http://www.gs1.org/).

anyOf.title: Mass
anyOf.description: Properties that take Mass as values are of the form '<Number> <Mass unit of measure>'. E.g., '7 kg'.

schema:sugarContent.title: sugarContent
schema:sugarContent.description: The number of grams of sugar.

anyOf.title: Mass
anyOf.description: Properties that take Mass as values are of the form '<Number> <Mass unit of measure>'. E.g., '7 kg'.

schema:offers.title: offers
schema:offers.description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event. Use [[businessFunction]] to indicate the kind of transaction offered, i.e. sell, lease, etc. This property can also be used to describe a [[Demand]]. While this property is listed as expected on a number of common types, it can be used in others. In that case, using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer.

anyOf.title: Demand
anyOf.description: A demand entity represents the public, not necessarily binding, not necessarily exclusive, announcement by an organization or person to seek a certain type of goods or services. For describing demand using this type, the very same properties used for Offer apply.

anyOf.title: Offer
anyOf.description:
An offer to transfer some rights to an item or to provide a service — for example, an offer to sell tickets to an event, to rent the DVD of a movie, to stream a TV show over the internet, to repair a motorcycle, or to loan a book.

Note: As the [[businessFunction]] property, which identifies the form of offer (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose), defaults to http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell; an Offer without a defined businessFunction value can be assumed to be an offer to sell.

For [GTIN](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin)-related fields, see [Check Digit calculator](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/support/check_digit_calculator) and [validation guide](http://www.gs1us.org/resources/standards/gtin-validation-guide) from [GS1](http://www.gs1.org/).

schema:lowPrice.title: lowPrice
schema:lowPrice.description:
The lowest price of all offers available.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

schema:highPrice.title: highPrice
schema:highPrice.description:
The highest price of all offers available.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

schema:offerCount.title: offerCount
schema:offerCount.description: The number of offers for the product.

anyOf.title: Integer
anyOf.description: Data type: Integer.

schema:offers.title: offers
schema:offers.description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event. Use [[businessFunction]] to indicate the kind of transaction offered, i.e. sell, lease, etc. This property can also be used to describe a [[Demand]]. While this property is listed as expected on a number of common types, it can be used in others. In that case, using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer.

anyOf.title: Demand
anyOf.description: A demand entity represents the public, not necessarily binding, not necessarily exclusive, announcement by an organization or person to seek a certain type of goods or services. For describing demand using this type, the very same properties used for Offer apply.

anyOf.title: Offer
anyOf.description:
An offer to transfer some rights to an item or to provide a service — for example, an offer to sell tickets to an event, to rent the DVD of a movie, to stream a TV show over the internet, to repair a motorcycle, or to loan a book.

Note: As the [[businessFunction]] property, which identifies the form of offer (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose), defaults to http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell; an Offer without a defined businessFunction value can be assumed to be an offer to sell.

For [GTIN](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin)-related fields, see [Check Digit calculator](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/support/check_digit_calculator) and [validation guide](http://www.gs1us.org/resources/standards/gtin-validation-guide) from [GS1](http://www.gs1.org/).

schema:itinerary.title: itinerary
schema:itinerary.description: Destination(s) ( [[Place]] ) that make up a trip. For a trip where destination order is important use [[ItemList]] to specify that order (see examples).

anyOf.title: ItemList
anyOf.description: A list of items of any sort—for example, Top 10 Movies About Weathermen, or Top 100 Party Songs. Not to be confused with HTML lists, which are often used only for formatting.

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

schema:subTrip.title: subTrip
schema:subTrip.description: Identifies a [[Trip]] that is a subTrip of this Trip.  For example Day 1, Day 2, etc. of a multi-day trip.

anyOf.title: Trip
anyOf.description: A trip or journey. An itinerary of visits to one or more places.

schema:provider.title: provider
schema:provider.description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

anyOf.title: Organization
anyOf.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

schema:partOfTrip.title: partOfTrip
schema:partOfTrip.description: Identifies that this [[Trip]] is a subTrip of another Trip.  For example Day 1, Day 2, etc. of a multi-day trip.

anyOf.title: Trip
anyOf.description: A trip or journey. An itinerary of visits to one or more places.

schema:shippingLabel.title: shippingLabel
schema:shippingLabel.description: Label to match an [[OfferShippingDetails]] with a [[ShippingRateSettings]] (within the context of a [[shippingSettingsLink]] cross-reference).

schema:doesNotShip.title: doesNotShip
schema:doesNotShip.description: Indicates when shipping to a particular [[shippingDestination]] is not available.

schema:shippingDestination.title: shippingDestination
schema:shippingDestination.description: indicates (possibly multiple) shipping destinations. These can be defined in several ways e.g. postalCode ranges.

anyOf.title: DefinedRegion
anyOf.description:
A DefinedRegion is a geographic area defined by potentially arbitrary (rather than political, administrative or natural geographical) criteria. Properties are provided for defining a region by reference to sets of postal codes.

Examples: a delivery destination when shopping. Region where regional pricing is configured.

Requirement 1:
Country: US
States: "NY", "CA"

Requirement 2:
Country: US
PostalCode Set: { [94000-94585], [97000, 97999], [13000, 13599]}
{ [12345, 12345], [78945, 78945], }
Region = state, canton, prefecture, autonomous community...

schema:shippingRate.title: shippingRate
schema:shippingRate.description: The shipping rate is the cost of shipping to the specified destination. Typically, the maxValue and currency values (of the [[MonetaryAmount]]) are most appropriate.

anyOf.title: MonetaryAmount
anyOf.description: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use [[PriceSpecification]] Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

schema:shippingSettingsLink.title: shippingSettingsLink
schema:shippingSettingsLink.description: Link to a page containing [[ShippingRateSettings]] and [[DeliveryTimeSettings]] details.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:deliveryTime.title: deliveryTime
schema:deliveryTime.description: The total delay between the receipt of the order and the goods reaching the final customer.

anyOf.title: ShippingDeliveryTime
anyOf.description: ShippingDeliveryTime provides various pieces of information about delivery times for shipping.

schema:transitTimeLabel.title: transitTimeLabel
schema:transitTimeLabel.description: Label to match an [[OfferShippingDetails]] with a [[DeliveryTimeSettings]] (within the context of a [[shippingSettingsLink]] cross-reference).

schema:postalCodePrefix.title: postalCodePrefix
schema:postalCodePrefix.description: A defined range of postal codes indicated by a common textual prefix. Used for non-numeric systems such as UK.

schema:addressCountry.title: addressCountry
schema:addressCountry.description: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1).

anyOf.title: Country
anyOf.description: A country.

schema:postalCodeRange.title: postalCodeRange
schema:postalCodeRange.description: A defined range of postal codes.

anyOf.title: PostalCodeRangeSpecification
anyOf.description: Indicates a range of postalcodes, usually defined as the set of valid codes between [[postalCodeBegin]] and [[postalCodeEnd]], inclusively.

schema:addressRegion.title: addressRegion
schema:addressRegion.description: The region in which the locality is, and which is in the country. For example, California or another appropriate first-level [Administrative division](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_administrative_divisions_by_country)

schema:postalCodeEnd.title: postalCodeEnd
schema:postalCodeEnd.description: Last postal code in the range (included). Needs to be after [[postalCodeBegin]].

schema:postalCodeBegin.title: postalCodeBegin
schema:postalCodeBegin.description: First postal code in a range (included).

schema:transitTime.title: transitTime
schema:transitTime.description: The typical delay the order has been sent for delivery and the goods reach the final customer. Typical properties: minValue, maxValue, unitCode (d for DAY).

anyOf.title: QuantitativeValue
anyOf.description: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

schema:cutoffTime.title: cutoffTime
schema:cutoffTime.description: Order cutoff time allows merchants to describe the time after which they will no longer process orders received on that day. For orders processed after cutoff time, one day gets added to the delivery time estimate. This property is expected to be most typically used via the [[ShippingRateSettings]] publication pattern. The time is indicated using the ISO-8601 Time format, e.g. "23:30:00-05:00" would represent 6:30 pm Eastern Standard Time (EST) which is 5 hours behind Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

schema:handlingTime.title: handlingTime
schema:handlingTime.description: The typical delay between the receipt of the order and the goods either leaving the warehouse or being prepared for pickup, in case the delivery method is on site pickup. Typical properties: minValue, maxValue, unitCode (d for DAY).  This is by common convention assumed to mean business days (if a unitCode is used, coded as "d"), i.e. only counting days when the business normally operates.

anyOf.title: QuantitativeValue
anyOf.description: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

schema:businessDays.title: businessDays
schema:businessDays.description: Days of the week when the merchant typically operates, indicated via opening hours markup.

anyOf.title: OpeningHoursSpecification
anyOf.description:
A structured value providing information about the opening hours of a place or a certain service inside a place.


The place is __open__ if the [[opens]] property is specified, and __closed__ otherwise.

If the value for the [[closes]] property is less than the value for the [[opens]] property then the hour range is assumed to span over the next day.

schema:contentType.title: contentType
schema:contentType.description: The supported content type(s) for an EntryPoint response.

schema:actionApplication.title: actionApplication
schema:actionApplication.description: An application that can complete the request.

anyOf.title: SoftwareApplication
anyOf.description: A software application.

schema:application.title: application
schema:application.description: An application that can complete the request.

anyOf.title: SoftwareApplication
anyOf.description: A software application.

schema:actionPlatform.title: actionPlatform
schema:actionPlatform.description: The high level platform(s) where the Action can be performed for the given URL. To specify a specific application or operating system instance, use actionApplication.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:encodingType.title: encodingType
schema:encodingType.description: The supported encoding type(s) for an EntryPoint request.

schema:httpMethod.title: httpMethod
schema:httpMethod.description: An HTTP method that specifies the appropriate HTTP method for a request to an HTTP EntryPoint. Values are capitalized strings as used in HTTP.

schema:urlTemplate.title: urlTemplate
schema:urlTemplate.description: An url template (RFC6570) that will be used to construct the target of the execution of the action.

schema:geoEquals.title: geoEquals
schema:geoEquals.description: Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) are topologically equal, as defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM). "Two geometries are topologically equal if their interiors intersect and no part of the interior or boundary of one geometry intersects the exterior of the other" (a symmetric relationship)

anyOf.title: GeospatialGeometry
anyOf.description: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

schema:geoDisjoint.title: geoDisjoint
schema:geoDisjoint.description: Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) are topologically disjoint: they have no point in common. They form a set of disconnected geometries." (a symmetric relationship, as defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM))

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

anyOf.title: GeospatialGeometry
anyOf.description: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

schema:geoTouches.title: geoTouches
schema:geoTouches.description: Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) touch: they have at least one boundary point in common, but no interior points." (a symmetric relationship, as defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM) )

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

anyOf.title: GeospatialGeometry
anyOf.description: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

schema:geoCovers.title: geoCovers
schema:geoCovers.description: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a covering geometry to a covered geometry. "Every point of b is a point of (the interior or boundary of) a". As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

anyOf.title: GeospatialGeometry
anyOf.description: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

schema:geoContains.title: geoContains
schema:geoContains.description: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a containing geometry to a contained geometry. "a contains b iff no points of b lie in the exterior of a, and at least one point of the interior of b lies in the interior of a". As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

anyOf.title: GeospatialGeometry
anyOf.description: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

schema:geoCoveredBy.title: geoCoveredBy
schema:geoCoveredBy.description: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to another that covers it. As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

anyOf.title: GeospatialGeometry
anyOf.description: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

schema:geoCrosses.title: geoCrosses
schema:geoCrosses.description: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to another that crosses it: "a crosses b: they have some but not all interior points in common, and the dimension of the intersection is less than that of at least one of them". As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

anyOf.title: GeospatialGeometry
anyOf.description: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

schema:geoWithin.title: geoWithin
schema:geoWithin.description: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to one that contains it, i.e. it is inside (i.e. within) its interior. As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

anyOf.title: GeospatialGeometry
anyOf.description: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

schema:geoIntersects.title: geoIntersects
schema:geoIntersects.description: Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) have at least one point in common. As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

anyOf.title: GeospatialGeometry
anyOf.description: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

schema:geoOverlaps.title: geoOverlaps
schema:geoOverlaps.description: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to another that geospatially overlaps it, i.e. they have some but not all points in common. As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

anyOf.title: Place
anyOf.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

anyOf.title: GeospatialGeometry
anyOf.description: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

schema:validFrom.title: validFrom
schema:validFrom.description: The date when the item becomes valid.

schema:validThrough.title: validThrough
schema:validThrough.description: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

schema:hoursAvailable.title: hoursAvailable
schema:hoursAvailable.description: The hours during which this service or contact is available.

anyOf.title: OpeningHoursSpecification
anyOf.description:
A structured value providing information about the opening hours of a place or a certain service inside a place.


The place is __open__ if the [[opens]] property is specified, and __closed__ otherwise.

If the value for the [[closes]] property is less than the value for the [[opens]] property then the hour range is assumed to span over the next day.

schema:mapType.title: mapType
schema:mapType.description: Indicates the kind of Map, from the MapCategoryType Enumeration.

anyOf.title: MapCategoryType
anyOf.description: An enumeration of several kinds of Map.

anyOf.title: Person
anyOf.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

schema:openingHours.title: openingHours
schema:openingHours.description: The general opening hours for a business. Opening hours can be specified as a weekly time range, starting with days, then times per day. Multiple days can be listed with commas ',' separating each day. Day or time ranges are specified using a hyphen '-'. * Days are specified using the following two-letter combinations: ```Mo```, ```Tu```, ```We```, ```Th```, ```Fr```, ```Sa```, ```Su```. * Times are specified using 24:00 format. For example, 3pm is specified as ```15:00```, 10am as ```10:00```. * Here is an example: <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Tu,Th 16:00-20:00">Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-8pm</time>. * If a business is open 7 days a week, then it can be specified as <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Mo-Su">Monday through Sunday, all day</time>.

schema:experienceRequirements.title: experienceRequirements
schema:experienceRequirements.description: Description of skills and experience needed for the position or Occupation.

anyOf.title: OccupationalExperienceRequirements
anyOf.description: Indicates employment-related experience requirements, e.g. [[monthsOfExperience]].

schema:skills.title: skills
schema:skills.description: A statement of knowledge, skill, ability, task or any other assertion expressing a competency that is desired or required to fulfill this role or to work in this occupation.

anyOf.title: DefinedTerm
anyOf.description: A word, name, acronym, phrase, etc. with a formal definition. Often used in the context of category or subject classification, glossaries or dictionaries, product or creative work types, etc. Use the name property for the term being defined, use termCode if the term has an alpha-numeric code allocated, use description to provide the definition of the term.

schema:estimatedSalary.title: estimatedSalary
schema:estimatedSalary.description: An estimated salary for a job posting or occupation, based on a variety of variables including, but not limited to industry, job title, and location. Estimated salaries  are often computed by outside organizations rather than the hiring organization, who may not have committed to the estimated value.

anyOf.title: MonetaryAmount
anyOf.description: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use [[PriceSpecification]] Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

anyOf.title: MonetaryAmountDistribution
anyOf.description: A statistical distribution of monetary amounts.

schema:occupationLocation.title: occupationLocation
schema:occupationLocation.description: The region/country for which this occupational description is appropriate. Note that educational requirements and qualifications can vary between jurisdictions.

anyOf.title: AdministrativeArea
anyOf.description: A geographical region, typically under the jurisdiction of a particular government.

schema:responsibilities.title: responsibilities
schema:responsibilities.description: Responsibilities associated with this role or Occupation.

schema:qualifications.title: qualifications
schema:qualifications.description: Specific qualifications required for this role or Occupation.

anyOf.title: EducationalOccupationalCredential
anyOf.description: An educational or occupational credential. A diploma, academic degree, certification, qualification, badge, etc., that may be awarded to a person or other entity that meets the requirements defined by the credentialer.

schema:occupationalCategory.title: occupationalCategory
schema:occupationalCategory.description:
A category describing the job, preferably using a term from a taxonomy such as [BLS O*NET-SOC](http://www.onetcenter.org/taxonomy.html), [ISCO-08](https://www.ilo.org/public/english/bureau/stat/isco/isco08/) or similar, with the property repeated for each applicable value. Ideally the taxonomy should be identified, and both the textual label and formal code for the category should be provided.\n
Note: for historical reasons, any textual label and formal code provided as a literal may be assumed to be from O*NET-SOC.

anyOf.title: CategoryCode
anyOf.description: A Category Code.

schema:educationRequirements.title: educationRequirements
schema:educationRequirements.description: Educational background needed for the position or Occupation.

anyOf.title: EducationalOccupationalCredential
anyOf.description: An educational or occupational credential. A diploma, academic degree, certification, qualification, badge, etc., that may be awarded to a person or other entity that meets the requirements defined by the credentialer.

schema:monthsOfExperience.title: monthsOfExperience
schema:monthsOfExperience.description: Indicates the minimal number of months of experience required for a position.

schema:currency.title: currency
schema:currency.description: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Tradings Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

schema:duration.title: duration
schema:duration.description: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

anyOf.title: Duration
anyOf.description: Quantity: Duration (use [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

schema:codeValue.title: codeValue
schema:codeValue.description: A short textual code that uniquely identifies the value.

schema:inCodeSet.title: inCodeSet
schema:inCodeSet.description: A [[CategoryCodeSet]] that contains this category code.

anyOf.title: CategoryCodeSet
anyOf.description: A set of Category Code values.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: Data type: URL.

schema:hasCategoryCode.title: hasCategoryCode
schema:hasCategoryCode.description: A Category code contained in this code set.

anyOf.title: CategoryCode
anyOf.description: A Category Code.
